H0.text: More protons than neutrons is the characteristic that best describes a neutral atom.

H1.text: A neutral atom is best described as having more electrons than protons.

H2.text: An equal number of protons and neutrons is what best describes a neutral atom.

H3.text: An equal number of protons and electrons is what best describes a neutral atom.

A4.text: Atoms typically have equal numbers of protons and electrons, in which case their charges cancel out, yielding a net charge of zero, thus making the atom neutral.

A5.text: If there are more electrons than protons in a piece of matter, it will have a negative charge, if there are fewer it will have a positive charge, and if there are equal numbers it will be neutral.
